title: China travel firms in share-swap deal: Bloomberg

China travel firms in share-swap deal: Bloomberg October 26, 2015 Internet giant Baidu, which controls the online travel site Qunar, will own 25 percent of rival Ctrip 
Two of China's largest online travel firms have agreed to a share swap and partnership deal to create the country's biggest Internet travel service, Bloomberg News reported Monday. 
Internet giant Baidu, which controls the online travel site Qunar, will own 25 percent of rival Ctrip, Bloomberg cited a company statement as saying. 
As part of the deal Ctrip will have a 45 percent stake in Qunar, it added. Qunar overall is valued at $7 billion. 
An expanding middle class is fuelling fierce competition for online bookings in China, a major source of outbound tourists. 
Qunar is China's leading seller of airline tickets, while Ctrip dominates hotel bookings.
